title: Resurrection & Pentecost; Church begins in Jerusalem
summary: Start of Christian movement; core proclamation (kerygma).

title: Council of Jerusalem (Acts 15)
summary: Early decision about Gentile inclusion and law observance.

title: Neronian persecution (traditionally)
summary: Early martyr narratives shape church identity.

title: Destruction of the Second Temple
summary: Major shift for Jewish-Christian relations; diaspora dynamics.

title: Apostolic Fathers (e.g., Clement, Ignatius) write
summary: Earliest post-NT witness to church order, Eucharist, martyrdom.

title: Justin Martyr describes Christian worship (First Apology)
summary: Early evidence for Eucharistic worship and liturgy.

title: Decian persecution
summary: Shapes penitential discipline; debates about lapsed Christians.

title: Armenia adopts Christianity as state religion (traditional dating)
summary: Early Christian kingdom outside Rome’s core.

title: Edict of Milan (toleration)
summary: Legalization of Christianity; end of major persecutions.

title: Council of Nicaea I: condemns Arianism; homoousios
summary: Trinitarian doctrine clarified; creed foundations.

title: Frumentius becomes first bishop; Christianity spreads in Ethiopia
summary: Major African Christian center with Alexandrian theology.

title: Council of Constantinople I: expands Nicene Creed; affirms Spirit’s divinity
summary: Standard Nicene-Constantinopolitan Creed text used broadly.

title: Synod/Council of Seleucia-Ctesiphon organizes Church of the East
summary: Formal organization of Persian Christianity under Catholicos.

title: Church of the East asserts independence from 'Church of the West' (traditional)
summary: Shows Rome/Byzantium vs Persia political barrier shaping ecclesiology.

title: Council of Ephesus: condemns Nestorius; affirms Theotokos language
summary: Christological definitions; seeds of East Syriac divergence.

title: Council of Chalcedon: Definition of Faith; 'in two natures'
summary: Major split with non-Chalcedonian (Oriental Orthodox) churches.

title: Non-Chalcedonian churches develop as Oriental Orthodox communion
summary: Coptic, Armenian, Syriac, Ethiopian, Malankara lines of continuity.

title: Council of Constantinople II (Fifth Ecumenical)
summary: Further Christological controversies (Three Chapters).

title: Early Islamic conquests reshape Christian landscape
summary: Christianity persists under Islamic rule; shifts centers of power.

title: Church of the East mission arrives in Tang China (Alopen)
summary: Evidence of early East Asian Christianity.

title: Council of Constantinople III: dyothelitism (two wills)
summary: Refines Chalcedonian Christology; rejects monothelitism.

title: Iconoclast Controversy
summary: Leads to Nicaea II and theology of icons.

title: Second Council of Nicaea: restores icons; veneration vs adoration
summary: Key for Orthodox/Catholic icon theology; disputed in some Protestant contexts.

title: Baptism of Rus’ (traditional dating)
summary: Eastern Orthodox Christianity spreads to Slavic world.

title: East–West Schism (mutual excommunications; later lifted 1965)
summary: Catholic vs Eastern Orthodox divide institutionalizes.

title: Crusades (broad period)
summary: Deepens East-West tensions; impacts Middle Eastern churches.

title: Fourth Crusade sacks Constantinople
summary: Major rupture between Latins and Greeks; lasting trauma.

title: Council of Florence attempts East-West reunion; includes filioque definitions
summary: Later referenced in Catholic theology; largely rejected in Orthodox reception.

title: Fall of Constantinople to Ottomans
summary: Orthodox center under Ottoman rule; shifts Christian geopolitics.

title: Martin Luther’s 95 Theses (traditional starting point)
summary: Catalyst for Western Reformation and denominational pluralization.

title: Augsburg Confession presented
summary: Foundational Lutheran confession.

title: Act of Supremacy (break with Rome; Church of England)
summary: Anglican tradition emerges.

title: Council of Trent (Catholic Reform)
summary: Responds to Reformation; defines justification, sacraments, etc.

title: Synod of Dort (Canons of Dort)
summary: Defines Reformed response to Remonstrants; TULIP later summary.

title: Westminster Confession produced
summary: Major Reformed/Presbyterian standard.

title: First Great Awakening
summary: Evangelical revivalism; affects denominational trajectories.

title: Second Great Awakening
summary: Rise of new movements; emphasis on conversion; influences holiness/restorationist streams.

title: Seventh-day Adventist Church organizes (formal denomination)
summary: Distinctive sabbatarian/eschatological Protestant tradition.

title: First Vatican Council defines papal primacy/infallibility
summary: High point of papal authority definitions; ecumenical flashpoint.

title: Azusa Street Revival
summary: Catalyst for global Pentecostalism.

title: Second Vatican Council
summary: Modern Catholic renewal; ecumenism; liturgical reforms.

title: Mutual lifting of 1054 excommunications (Paul VI & Athenagoras)
summary: Symbolic healing step though full communion not restored.

title: Byzantine/Coptic missions and Nubian conversion; kingdoms of Noubadia, Makuria, Alwa become Christian
summary: Shows early ‘global South’ Christian polities outside Roman/Byzantine core; later influences African Christianity conversations.

title: Baqt treaty between Makuria and Muslim Egypt (long-lasting political arrangement)
summary: Explains long survival of Nubian Christian kingdoms after Islamic expansion; helps trace later Islamization dynamics.

title: Gradual decline and Islamization of Nubian Christian kingdoms; Makuria falls; Alwa declines later
summary: Shows how political/economic forces can extinguish a once-flourishing Christian tradition (not just ‘doctrinal failure’).

title: Era of the Nine Saints: monastic expansion and consolidation of Ethiopian Christianity
summary: Helps explain the distinctive ‘Tewahedo’ profile: monasticism, translation, and formation of a stable local tradition.

title: Jesuit mission attempts union with Rome; conversion of Emperor Susenyos (1622) followed by backlash; expulsion (1632)
summary: Case study in ‘union vs continuity’: how political conversion pressures can trigger violent religious instability and later harden boundaries.

title: Arrival of Church of the East (Jingjiao) missionaries in Chang’an (Xi’an)
summary: Demonstrates early Asian Christian presence via Syriac networks; challenges ‘Christianity arrived late’ narratives about Asia.

title: Xi’an (Nestorian) Stele erected, narrating Christianity’s arrival and imperial reception in China
summary: Gives a concrete dated artifact for Church of the East presence in China and its self-description.

title: Huichang persecution: suppression of foreign religions contributes to decline of Jingjiao communities
summary: Explains discontinuity of early East Syriac presence; helps interpret later ‘re-introductions’ of Christianity.

title: Synod of Diamper (Udayamperoor): Portuguese/Jewuit-led synod brings Thomas Christians under Roman authority
summary: Major fork: Latinization pressure and jurisdictional conflict set up later fractures (1653 and beyond).

title: Coonan Cross Oath: mass resistance by Thomas Christians against Portuguese Padroado control
summary: A clear ‘bifurcation moment’ producing multiple later lines: Syro-Malabar, Malankara Orthodox/Jacobite, Mar Thoma, Syro-Malankara, etc.

title: Arrival of Syriac Orthodox bishop (Mar Gregorios) and consolidation of West Syriac line in Malankara
summary: Explains why part of Malankara becomes West Syriac (Oriental Orthodox) rather than East Syriac.

title: Syro-Malankara Catholic Church begins (reunion stream with Rome)
summary: Adds a ‘reunion’ branch distinct from Syro-Malabar and Malankara OO lines.

title: Chinese Rites Controversy: conflict over Confucian/ancestor rites in Catholic missions
summary: Key case for how ‘inculturation’ debates can shape doctrine/practice boundaries and later Catholic policy.

title: Benedict XIV’s bull *Ex quo singulari* forbids certain accommodation practices
summary: Acts as a boundary marker for acceptable local rites; reverberates in mission theology and later policy reversal (20th c.).

title: Vatican policy change permits certain Chinese rites under conditions (reversal after 1742 era)
summary: Shows that some ‘practice-boundary’ decisions are revisited; important for legitimacy scoring of ‘novel’ vs ‘revived’ practices.
keyFigures: Congregation for the Propagation of the Faith (Propaganda Fide)

title: Ethiopianism and early African church self-governance movements (roots of AICs)
summary: A key origin point for later African independent denominations and colonial-era schisms.

title: Aladura movement begins (prayer/healing; independent prophet-healing churches)
summary: Helps trace charismatic healing emphases to early 20th-century West African contexts (distinct from Azusa-only narratives).

title: Cherubim & Seraphim society forms within Aladura stream
summary: Concrete branch point within Aladura tradition; adds specificity to ‘AIC’ umbrella.
keyFigures: Moses Orimolade Tunolase; Christiana Abiodun Akinsowon

title: Simon Kimbangu’s movement begins; later forms the Kimbanguist Church
summary: Key African independent tradition; often discussed in relation to colonial authority, prophecy, and distinctive theology.

title: Georgian church autocephaly (early tradition)
summary: Adds a Caucasus center to the map; shows early autocephalous development outside the Latin/Greek core.

title: Christianity introduced in Aksum under Ezana
summary: Anchors Ethiopian Christianity in late antiquity and ties later doctrinal/liturgical continuity to Aksumite roots.

title: Nubia’s three Christian kingdoms (Nobatia, Makuria, Alwa)
summary: Prevents 'Nubia = one church' flattening; supports tracing differences across the three kingdoms.

title: Baqt treaty between Christian Nubia (Makuria) and Muslim Egypt
summary: Explains how Christian institutions survived for centuries under treaty dynamics; key for 'decline' narratives.
keyFigures: Makurian king; Abd Allah ibn Sa'd

title: Arrival of Church of the East mission (Jingjiao) in China
summary: Pins the China storyline to a dated, material witness and an established mission corridor.

title: Jingjiao (Xi’an) Stele erected (Chinese+Syriac)
summary: Provides a primary artifact for doctrine/liturgy/terminology in early Chinese Christianity.

title: Syriac Christianity expands along Silk Road networks
summary: Adds Central Asia as a sustained Christian region and explains linguistic/ritual transmission paths.

title: Synod of Diamper formalizes union with Rome for Thomas Christians
summary: Major bifurcation trigger: authority, rite pressure, and later split-lines.

title: Coonan Cross Oath rejects Portuguese/JJesuit authority
summary: Anchor point for Puthenkoor line and later Malankara family; crucial to Kerala micro-splits.

title: Ex illa die restricts Chinese rites
summary: Primary-text anchor for 'civil vs religious' boundary decisions in missions.

title: Ex quo singulari reaffirms restrictions
summary: Locks restriction line; shows how discipline can be strongly enforced across centuries.

title: Plane compertum est allows participation in certain rites
summary: Shows reversal/clarification: state rites deemed civil; adds nuance to 'doctrine vs discipline'.

title: Native Ethiopian abuna appointed (Basil)
summary: Modern institutional milestone; shows internal leadership transition (not only external patriarchal links).

title: Ethiopian patriarchate established
summary: Clarifies communion relationships and modern autocephaly claims.

title: Old Apostolic/Ancient Church of the East emerges from split
summary: Internal differentiation within East Syriac tradition; prevents flattening 'Church of the East'.

title: Aladura movement begins (prayer/healing churches)
summary: Key AIC family; expands doctrine mapping beyond Western denominational categories.

title: Kimbanguist movement begins
summary: Major AIC lineage; introduces authority/prophecy questions into doctrine atlas.

title: Kimbanguist Church admitted to WCC
summary: Shows AIC ecumenical recognition path; impacts modern identity and doctrine statements.

title: Hidden Christians persist underground (Kakure Kirishitan)
summary: Adds East Asia continuity line; helps explain hybridization/retention under persecution.

title: Didache (Teaching of the Twelve Apostles)
summary: Key topics: Baptism; Eucharist; ethics; church order

title: Nicene-Constantinopolitan Creed
summary: Key topics: Trinity; Christ; Spirit; one baptism; resurrection

title: Council of Ephesus
summary: Key topics: Christology; Theotokos; condemnation of Nestorius

title: Council of Chalcedon (Definition of Faith)
summary: Key topics: Christology (two natures); ecclesial canons

title: Second Council of Nicaea
summary: Key topics: Icons; veneration vs adoration

title: Augustine: City of God
summary: Key topics: Church & empire; providence; history; politics

title: Large Catechism (Luther)
summary: Key topics: Ten Commandments; Creed; Lord's Prayer; Baptism; Eucharist; Confession

title: Augsburg Confession
summary: Key topics: Justification; sacraments; church

title: Thirty-Nine Articles of Religion
summary: Key topics: Scripture; church; sacraments; purgatory; predestination

title: Council of Trent (Justification)
summary: Key topics: Justification; grace; cooperation; merit (definitions)

title: Council of Trent (Eucharist)
summary: Key topics: Real presence; transubstantiation; Eucharistic worship

title: Westminster Confession of Faith
summary: Key topics: Scripture; covenant; sacraments; church; salvation

title: Canons of Dort
summary: Key topics: Election; grace; perseverance

title: Second London Baptist Confession
summary: Key topics: Church; ordinances; salvation; covenant

title: Baptist Faith and Message
summary: Key topics: Scripture; God; salvation; church; ordinances

title: Assemblies of God Statement of Fundamental Truths
summary: Key topics: Salvation; Spirit baptism; ordinances; gifts; healing; eschatology

title: UMC Articles of Religion
summary: Key topics: Trinity; Scripture; sin; sacraments; sanctification

title: SDA 28 Fundamental Beliefs
summary: Key topics: Scripture; Sabbath; sanctuary; second coming; etc.

title: Vatican I: Pastor Aeternus
summary: Key topics: Papal primacy; infallibility

title: Ineffabilis Deus
summary: Key topics: Immaculate Conception

title: Munificentissimus Deus
summary: Key topics: Assumption

title: Synod of Diamper (Udayamperoor) decrees
summary: Key topics: Kerala split-lines; authority; liturgy; Latinization

title: Coonan Cross Oath (event text tradition)
summary: Key topics: Resistance to Padroado; jurisdiction; schism trigger

title: Chinese Rites decrees & debates (selected)
summary: Key topics: Inculturation; ancestor rites; Confucian rites; papal authority

title: Ex quo singulari
summary: Key topics: Prohibition of certain accommodation practices

title: 1939 Propaganda Fide decision on Chinese rites (policy shift)
summary: Key topics: Conditional permission of certain Chinese rites; boundaries of inculturation

title: Xi'an (Nestorian) Stele inscription
summary: Key topics: Jingjiao presence; early Chinese Christianity; Silk Road missions

title: Code of Canons of the Eastern Churches (CCEO)
summary: Key topics: Rite; sui iuris; governance

title: Clement of Rome
summary: Early church order; leadership; unity Key works: 1 Clement

title: Ignatius of Antioch
summary: Early episcopacy; Eucharist; unity Key works: Letters

title: Irenaeus of Lyons
summary: Rule of faith; apostolic succession; gnosticism Key works: Against Heresies

title: Tertullian
summary: Early Latin theology; Trinity terminology seeds Key works: Apologetic works

title: Origen
summary: Biblical interpretation; early theology (with later controversies) Key works: On First Principles; biblical commentaries

title: Athanasius of Alexandria
summary: Anti-Arian theology; incarnation Key works: On the Incarnation

title: Basil the Great
summary: Trinity; Spirit’s divinity; liturgy Key works: On the Holy Spirit

title: Gregory Nazianzen
summary: Trinitarian theology; Christology Key works: Theological Orations

title: John Chrysostom
summary: Preaching; liturgy; ethics Key works: Homilies

title: Augustine of Hippo
summary: Grace; church; politics; doctrine development Key works: Confessions; City of God; On Trinity

title: Cyril of Alexandria
summary: Christology; Theotokos debates Key works: Letters (Ephesus)

title: Leo the Great
summary: Chalcedon context; Christology Key works: Tome of Leo

title: Maximus the Confessor
summary: Dyothelitism; theosis Key works: Ambigua; theology of wills

title: John of Damascus
summary: Icons; systematic theology Key works: On the Divine Images; Exposition of the Orthodox Faith

title: Ephrem the Syrian
summary: Syriac theology and poetry; global Christianity beyond Greek/Latin Key works: Hymns
